intro: Erodium narbonense, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a characteristic species of dry, sunny habitats.
